articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Can Never Evade Responsibility for Bringing
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Can Never Evade Responsibility for Bringing Inter-Korean Relations to Collapse: Spokesman for NDC
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors on May 19 let a guy claiming to be a spokesman for Chongwadae spread rumor that the "true intention" reflected in Lee's "Berlin proposal" was conveyed to the DPRK side at a secret contact made between the north and the south of Korea in Beijing recently. A spokesman for the DPRK National Defence Commission Wednesday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards this:
					The above-said group is master hands at fabrications as they cook up lies and deny what they have done and hooligans who renege on the promises made to the nation like a pair of old shoes.
					
					This is clearly evidenced by the "Cheonan" sinking case and Yonphyong Island shelling case.
					
					It is a sheer lie that at the Beijing secret contact the south side briefed the DPRK side on the "real intention" reflected in the "Berlin proposal" made by traitor Lee.
					
					Now that the Lee group let the spokesman for Chongwadae open to public the above-mentioned secret contact first on the basis of fabrications and is busy floating nonsensical stories, the DPRK side has no option but to clarify it as it happened.
					
					Finding it hard to evade the responsibility for having driven the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe, the Lee group was aware that the crisis in the closing period of its rule might further deepen due to the situation. Hence, entering April the group made repeated requests to "hold a secret contact for the 'summit talks,' saying it would no more talk about 'Cheonan' warship sinking case and Yonphyong Island shelling case."
					
					And it made poor excuses that what matters is that Lee's "policy towards the north" is "misunderstood" by the north and the south, in fact, stands for the improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					Kim Chon Sik, chief of the policy room of the puppet ministry of unification, Hong Chang Hwa, director of the intelligence service, and Kim Thae Hyo, senior presidential secretary for foreign strategy of secretariat of Chongwadae, and others came out to the venue of the secret contact that started on May 9. They, however, began playing jugglery to wrest apology from the DPRK side, asserting that the above-said cases were "mountains to be crossed with wisdom" for the improvement of the south-north relations. This was a breach of the promise made to the DPRK side earlier.
					
					When it declared that it was preposterous to say the word "apology" over the cases with which it had nothing to do and just measures for self-defence, they asked it to put forth "a compromise proposal" to be declared before the world, the proposal which cannot be interpreted as apology, when viewed by the north side but as apology when viewed by the south side. They implored the north to "make a little concession".
					
					When the DPRK side told them to go back to Seoul at once, saying it is not necessary to discuss the issue of the summit talks in which unreasonable "apology" raised as a pre-condition, they tried hard to keep the contact going on at any cost, saying that it would not be long before Lee Myung Bak's tenure of office would end, the present authorities are hard pressed for time and it is more favorable to push forward the inter-Korean relations by joining hands with the conservative forces, in stead of doing so with the progressive forces.
					
					Noting that a program for all events for the opening of the "summit talks" has already been worked out, they said that depending on the settlement of the issues of the two cases, they expected to open ministerial talks for the "summit talks" late in May to announce agreed points, hold the first round of the "summit talks‚Äù in Panmunjom late in June, the second one in Pyongyang two months later and the third round of the "summit talks" during the summit for nuclear security slated to take place in March next year. They earnestly begged the DPRK side to take this embarrassing situation into consideration.
					
					When the DPRK side clarified its steadfast stand that such summit talks cannot take place as long as the south side insists on the hostile policy towards the DPRK, persistently claiming that the north should "dismantle its nukes first" and calling for "an apology" for the two cases, they asked it to express at least "regret" at the two cases, proposed meeting in Malaysia again to conclude the discussion of this issue and urged it to rapidly push forward the arrangements for opening the "summit talks". They went the lengths of showing off enveloped money to lure someone but suffered shame.
					
					The puppet group asked the DPRK side to keep secret what was said at the secret contact, saying the situation in south Korea is complicated unlike that in the north and if that is known to the south, it will entail adverse consequences. They repeatedly asked the north side to keep secret the accounts of the contact as nobody knows about this except Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification, the director of the intelligence service and the presidential secretary-general who looked after the secret contact at the personal instruction of "President" Lee and those sent to Beijing for the contact.
					
					It was these guys who first opened to the public the misrepresented accounts of the secret Beijing contact in an attempt to propagandize the "justice" of the "Berlin proposal."
					
					This is the whole story about the secret contact that the spokesman for Chongwadae claimed the real intention reflected in the proposal was conveyed to the north before and after May 19.
					
					Had the Lee group have the true intention to improve the north-south relations, it should not have let loose such reckless remarks as what it called "Berlin proposal" and refrained from perpetrating such perfidy as opening to the public the misrepresented accounts of the secret contact.
					
					All facts glaringly show what desperate efforts the Lee is making to shirk the responsibility for having driven the north-south relations to collapse in the closing period of its rule.
					
					For all his desperate efforts the traitor cannot evade the responsibility for the crimes committed against the nation and reunification for three years in power.
					
					The DPRK will make every possible effort to ensure peace, reunification and stability on the Korean Peninsula but it will no longer deal with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors which meanly behaves, uttering incoherent words to achieve its sinister political aim.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Ghanaian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Ghanaian Ambassador 
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Helen Mamle Kofi, Ghanaian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday. 
					 After receiving the credentials Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Italian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Italian President
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Giorgio Napolitano, president of Italy, on its national day this year marking the 150th anniversary of Italy's unity.
					Expressing hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in different fields, Kim in the message wished the President and the people of Italy successes in their efforts for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Algerian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Algerian Ambassador to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Hassane Rabehi, Algerian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Ghanaian President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Ghanaian President
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from John Evans Atta Mills, president of Ghana.
					 Ghanaian Ambassador to the DPRK Helen Mamle Kofi handed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday.

articles.title: 6.15 All Committee Decides to Open Rally for Peaceful Reunification
articles.content:
6.15 All Committee Decides to Open Rally for Peaceful Reunification 
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- June 15 All-Korean Committee expressed deep concern over the grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and issued a press release Wednesday for the purpose of thoroughly implementing the north-south joint declaration in keeping with the aspiration and wishes of all fellow countrymen.
					 According to the press release, the North, South and Overseas Side Committees for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration agreed to open a grand national rally for peaceful reunification marking the 11th anniversary of the joint declaration in Kaesong (industrial zone included) on June 15 with 100 persons from the north, 100 persons from the south and at least 60 persons from overseas attending in the direction of making a positive contribution to national concord and peace and reunification of the country in the spirit of the joint declaration on the above-said occasion.
					
					 They agreed to organize colorful events such as an opening ceremony, a seminar, inter-sector meetings, an art performance, visits to historic sites in Kaesong area and a closing ceremony.
					
					 They also agreed to hold colorful events in various areas in the north and the south and abroad.

articles.title: June 1 International Children's Day Marked
articles.content:
June 1 International Children's Day Marked
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting of children and women in Pyongyang and foreign children and women took place at the Taesongsan Pleasure Ground on Wednesday, the International Children's Day.
					  Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, and children and women in the city.
					
					 Present there on invitation were children and women of foreign diplomatic missions and missions of international organizations here, foreign guests and overseas compatriots staying in the homeland.
					
					 Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, made a congratulatory speech at the meeting.
					
					She warmly congratulated all the children across the country who are stoutly growing to be masters of Songun Korea under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and children of different countries present.
					
					 After the rhythmic exercise of kindergarteners was over, the children were divided into two groups and had sports and amusement games. 
					
					 Korean and foreign children played games including jumping over flower-strewn lines, snatching balls, playing at soldiers, picking up toys and tug of war.
					
					 An art performance was given by children at the meeting.
					
					 Korean children presented such numbers as boy solo and pangchang "Korean Child" and amusement dance "Pleasant Counting", representing their happy appearance.
					
					 Foreign children sang Korean songs including chorus "Birthplace in Mt. Paektu" and "We Are the Happiest in the World".
					
					 At the end of the games, the participants spent a pleasant time, dancing together and using amusement facilities.

articles.title: June 1 International Children's Day Celebrated
articles.content:
June 1 International Children's Day Celebrated
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Children in the DPRK celebrated the June 1 International Children's Day.
					 Children's sports and amusement games and art performances took place at nurseries and kindergartens including the Kim Jong Suk Nursery, the Kang Pan Sok Nursery, the Changgwang Kindergarten, Tangsang Nursery No. 1 and at parks and recreation grounds in Pyongyang. 
					
					 They performed a morning exercise and rhythmic exercise to the tune of "Today Is June 1 Children's Day" and "We Are Also Boy Generals" and played games including picking up toys, crossing  stone bridge, running with balls in arms and rabbit jumping.
					
					 Children good at singing and dancing and reading Korean books and counting were introduced. 
					
					 Children across the country also marked the day significantly.

articles.title: Children Enjoy Their Holiday
articles.content:
Children Enjoy Their Holiday
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The children throughout the DPRK have celebrated the International Children's Day, June 1.
					 They have enjoyed the holiday with various sports games and amusements.
					
					 The DPRK government has paid deep concern to rearing children, regarding the nursing and upbringing of children as one of the most important state affairs.
					
					 The DPRK adopted the Law on the Nursing and Upbringing of Children at the Sixth Session of the Fifth Supreme People's Assembly in April Juche 65 (1976).
					
					 All the children receive equal benefits of the state, irrespective of their parents' occupation.
					
					 All nurseries and kindergartens are built and operated at public expense and they supply children with foodstuffs free of charge.
					
					 They direct the primary attention to educating the children in a healthy way and cultivating their talents.
					
					 A regular medical service is also available for all the children in the country.

articles.title: New Portable Toothbrush Produced
articles.content:
New Portable Toothbrush Produced
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory turns out varieties of consumer goods.
					 Recently, it began mass-producing a new kind of portable toothbrush.
					
					Dr. Ri Kyong Il, a workshop head of the factory, told KCNA that the toothbrush consists of case, brush and paste. The case is also used as the handle.
					
					 The new model is lower in production cost than other kinds of portable toothbrush.
					
					 The factory also produces antibiotic toothbrushes with nano-materials and functional materials.

articles.title: Kangryong Tea Enjoys Popularity
articles.content:
Kangryong Tea Enjoys Popularity
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Cool tea has become increasingly popular among people with the temperature getting higher.
					 The Yonggwang Street Restaurant in Central District, Pyongyang, has installed a stand in front of it to serve Kangryong tea.
					
					 Kangryong green tea and Kangryong black tea are in great demand for their nice smell and flavor.
					
					 Kim Pong Gil, a 68-year-old man living in Ryonhwa-dong No. 2 in Central District, told KCNA that he has taken various kinds of tea but found that Kangryong tea is the best.
					
					 "The tea helps feel fine and vigorous, so I recommended my family members to take Kangryong tea," he added.

articles.title: Favorite Song of Korean Youth
articles.content:
Favorite Song of Korean Youth
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The art group of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education gave performances at the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang some time ago. The program included the song "March of Korean Youth".
					 The song, created in Juche 36 (1947), reflects the pride of the young Korean people in devoting their strength and wisdom to the prosperity of the country.
					
					 The song is made up of appealing words and spirited melodies.
					
					 It, inspiring the youth to great deeds, has enjoyed popularity among them from the period of the building of a new society after the liberation of the country from a Japanese colonial rule.

articles.title: Lake Jingbo in China
articles.content:
Lake Jingbo in China
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Lake Jingbo, one of the most famous scenic spots in China, is associated with President Kim Il Sung's great feats in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					 A unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army for the first expedition to north Manchuria, under the command of the President, defeated Japanese imperialist aggressors in Shitouhe near the lake in November Juche 23 (1934) in cooperation with a Chinese unit.
					
					 The victory in the battle gave a momentum to the anti-Japanese sentiments among both the Korean and Chinese people and helped better the armed equipment of a KPRA unit and the Zhou Bao-zhong unit active in north Manchuria.
					
					 When the President came again to the lake during the second expedition to north Manchuria, he sang the famous "Song of Su Wu" representing the Chinese people's patriotic feelings.
					
					 From late February to early March 1936, the President presided over a historic meeting in Nanhutou south of the lake.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, during his visit to northeast China some days ago, was deeply moved to see the lake associated with great feats the President performed in the struggle for liberating the country.
					
					 A Chinese official told Kim Jong Il that he came to the lake, called back upon the great feats of the President and shared friendly feelings with the Chinese people and looked far into the beautiful future of the bilateral relations. 
					
					 "This greatly impresses us and encourages us to redouble our efforts," he added.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Japanese Government's Row about "Issue of Abduction"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Japanese Government's Row about "Issue of Abduction" 
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government is recklessly kicking up an anti-DPRK row about abduction. 
					 Japan decided to include the "issue of abduction" in the contents of education at all schools. Its chief executive during his foreign junkets begged for cooperation in the efforts to solve the "issue of abduction".
					
					 Japan's assertion is that there is no more serious human rights issue than the "issue of abduction" for Japan and this is a fundamental issue to be solved to improve the DPRK-Japan relations. 
					
					 This is ridiculous, indeed. It is a crafty method peculiar to Japan, political dwarf, to attain its sinister political purpose by a despicable and petty trick.
					
					 Japan is the world's worst human rights abuser and a war criminal which has no justification to raise "the issue of abduction" and human rights issue to the DPRK from the moral and legal viewpoint.
					
					Japan took away and abducted many Koreans including 200,000 Korean women to suffer slavery. It has not yet redeemed the brutal slavery committed in the past.
					
					 This is the hideous crime for which Japan should be punished unconditionally according to the "convention on not applying the statute of limitation to the war crimes and the crimes against humanity". 
					
					 Japan seeks a sinister political aim in enforcing the education in the "issue of abduction" aimed at infusing bitterness towards the DPRK into young Japanese. 
					
					 Its purpose is to cover up unethical crimes committed by it in the past, go without redressing them and escalate the confrontation between the DPRK and Japan in a bid to prolong the remaining days of rule.
					
					 The successive Japanese rulers behaved so. Not only during the period of the rule of the Liberal Democratic Party represented by Abe and others but also during the rule of the present Democratic Party of Japan the authorities have resorted to such base method to turn Japan into a normal state free from the moral responsibility for the past crimes and bring political crisis at home under control.  
					
					  The Japanese authorities have become crafty to employ it for their old "abduction" farce at a time when the international community is getting increasingly assertive for promoting the process of peace and denuclearization on the Korean Peninsula. There are voices of caution among the countries concerned that Japan is revealing its intention to include the "abduction issue" in the "prior measure for the resumption of the six-party talks". 
					
					 However, Japan's trick is too poor to fish in troubled waters with the "abduction issue". 
					
					 The Japanese authorities raised the issue of Megumi Yokoda as the core of the "abduction issue". It had been already disclosed that their assertion is like insisting on bringing the dead to life. 
					
					 As already reported, even a representative of an anti-DPRK organization of south Korea who was deeply involved in the issue of Megumi Yokoda in August 2006 said that the Japanese government used the "abduction issue" for such political purpose as "employing it as a lever for pressuring north Korea" though it knew well about the death of Megumi. In Japan the Asahi TV in May 2009 disclosed that the Foreign Ministry of Japan knew that Megumi was not alive, sparking sensation at home and abroad. 
					
					 The international community treats Japan as a political dwarf as it employs such base and mean methods. In order to get rid of this position the Japanese authorities should not play sleight of hand but honestly reflect on their past wrongs and properly settle them. Doing so is the fundamental and primary issue arising in the DPRK-Japan relations.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Accused of Its Action to Scuttle Reunification Event
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Accused of Its Action to Scuttle Reunification Event 
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet conservative group recently committed an anti-reunification action by disallowing the delegation of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to visit Kaesong for contact among the north, south and overseas sides of All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration. 
					 The group disallowed those concerned of the south side committee to meet with those from the north in a third country. And it refused twice to allow the permanent representative of the south side committee and his party to take part in the meeting of the co-chairmen of the north and the south and overseas side committees. 
					
					 A spokesman for the north side committee said in a statement on Wednesday: 
					
					 This is an intolerable challenge to the strong desire of all Koreans for reunification. 
					
					 To block the June 15 joint event is a total denial of national concord, unity, peace and reunification. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group's moves to scuttle the June 15 joint national event at any cost are nothing but a sinister intention to chill the desire for reunification daily growing at home and abroad and keep pushing the inter-Korean relations to acute confrontation. 
					
					 If the puppet group persists in acts against reunification, blocking contacts and visits of NGOs in the north and the south under the signboard of the "May 24 measure" and so on, this will only precipitate its shameful destruction in face of the strong resistance of all Koreans desirous of national reunification.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts Japanese Reactionaries' Reckless Military Moves
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts Japanese Reactionaries' Reckless Military Moves 
						
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Defense Ministry of Japan made a final decision recently to host the take-off and landing exercise of carrier-based planes on Mage Island in Kagoshima Prefecture after their transfer from the U.S. forces Atsugi base to the Iwakuni base under a realignment plan of the U.S. forces in Japan. 
					 Meanwhile, the ministry decided to let units of fighters of Air "Self-Defense Force" take part in the joint exercises with U.S. forces to be held in Alaska State. 
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are getting frantic with the moves to tighten the relations of military cooperation with the U.S. despite the unprecedented natural disasters and nuclear calamity. This reveals itself how persistent and keen they are on sycophancy towards the U.S. and wild ambition for militarist overseas aggression. 
					
					 It is the ulterior motive of the Japanese reactionaries to turn Japan into a military power and launch militarist overseas aggression even at the sacrifice of the interests of its people as early as possible.
					
					 They consider it as a key link in the chain efforts for launching overseas aggression to boost the military cooperation with the U.S. and hasten the military integration between the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" and the U.S. forces in Japan and round off the capability for joint military action. In other words, it is their sinister intention to realize their dream of emerging again a leader of Asia backed by the U.S. at any cost. 
					
					 Japan is the only country in the world which begs for maintaining and strengthening the alliance even sacrificing the vital interests of the country and its people, although it has alliance with the U.S.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries calculate that they can lead their country to emerge the leader of Asia in return for kowtowing to the U.S. and cooperating with it. But this is a daydream. 
					
					 Any attempt on the part of Japan to benefit by clinging to the coattails of the U.S. pursuing wars is bound to invite disasters.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Blamed for Pushing North-South Relations to Uncontrollable Phase
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Blamed for Pushing North-South Relations to Uncontrollable Phase
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The north-south relations reached an uncontrollable phase. This is entirely attributable to the Lee Myung Bak group which escalated confrontation with the DPRK from the very day it came to power.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The conservative group of south Korea had no intention to develop the inter-Korean relations and work for reunification through dialogue and negotiations from the outset, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 The Lee group's "policy toward the north" is an unprecedented confrontation policy as it totally negates the relations that had existed between the north and the south since the advent of the June 15 era.
					
					 The north-south relations have been seriously affected by the moves for confrontation and war for the past more than three years due to the reckless treacherous acts of the Lee regime to realize its ambition for "unifying the systems" while antagonizing fellow countrymen.
					
					 It has become clear that it has not an iota of intention to have dialogue with the DPRK but is only keen to stand in confrontation with it to the last and realize its scenario to invade it by force of arms.
					
					 The present puppet authorities are die-hard confrontation maniacs who gave up their idea to live with compatriots under the same sky. They are a group of hooligans bereft of elementary political sense, national character and human ethics and morality.
					
					 The DPRK has nothing to be bound to anything or has no reason to hesitate now that it is fully aware of the true intention of the Lee group. Pinning any hope on it now is little short of wasting time.

articles.title: Reactionaries' Moves to Suppress National Education of Koreans in Japan Assailed
articles.content:
Reactionaries' Moves to Suppress National Education of Koreans in Japan Assailed 
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the ultra-right conservative organization of Japan called "Rescue Association-Fukuoka" termed subsidies provided by the government of Fukuoka Prefecture to Korean schools in Japan as "illegal" and filed a suit with the local court in Fukuoka against this. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' moves to suppress the national education at the Korean schools in Japan under the pretext that it is "politically motivated education" are nothing but despicable and heinous criminal actions to infringe upon the national identity and the rights of the Koreans in Japan to national education. 
					
					 Japan has the moral and legal responsibility and obligation to protect the democratic national rights of the Koreans in Japan and honestly help the Korean schools in Japan in their national education, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 This notwithstanding, the Japanese ultra-right conservative forces are working hard to bar the authorities from paying subsidies by attaching groundless label "politically motivated education" to the national education at the Korean schools in Japan. This is a manifestation of the extreme bitterness towards the DPRK and the national chauvinism.
					
					 The above-said moves are nothing but a poor trick to deprive the Koreans in Japan of the right to national education and destroy the Korean educational institutions in Japan by all means.
					
					 The moves to suppress the national education at the Korean schools in Japan, educational institutions under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, are also a blatant challenge to it and an undisguised hostile act against the DPRK. 
					
					 The Japanese authorities should view this issue with cool heads, serve warnings against the ultra-right conservative forces' anti-DPRK hostile acts and respect and protect the democratic national rights of the Koreans in Japan in the light of international law and on a humanitarian principle and help the Korean schools in Japan in their national education. 
					
					 The DPRK will closely follow how the Japanese authorities will react to the reckless acts of the above-said elements.

articles.title: US Forces Accused of Reducing South Korea to Land Unfit for Human Habitation
articles.content:
US Forces Accused of Reducing South Korea to Land Unfit for Human Habitation 
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Recent days witnessed the successive disclosure of U.S. forces' burial of toxic chemicals in different parts of south Korea. 
					 There is a new testimony that the U.S. forces sprayed defoliant in the demilitarized zone in the middle of the 1950s.
					
					 Um To Nam, who served in the south Korean puppet army, said on May 30 that "the U.S. forces sprayed defoliant in the demilitarized zone three or four times in a month by airplane in 1955 when he served in the 15th division of the army".
					
					 His testimony draws attention of public as it is different from the fact that defoliant was massively sprayed in the demilitarized zone under the command of the U.S. forces late in the 1960s.
					
					The U.S. forces mapped out such "operation plan" as "1968 plan for the control over flora" and sprayed defoliant amounting to 80,000 liters in the area along the 155-mile Military Demarcation Line with soldiers of the south Korean puppet army involved.
					
					 According to a report worked out by the then U.S. Defense Department, defoliant sprayed in south Korea was more toxic than what the U.S. used during its Vietnam war of aggression. 
					
					 Three ex-GIs who served in the Waegwan U.S. military base in Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea, testified to the fact on May 16 that defoliant amounting to 50 tons was buried in the base in 1978. Timed to coincide with this, other U.S. veterans who served in the U.S. forces present in south Korea and south Koreans who worked in the U.S. base also testified one after another to the fact that the U.S. forces buried toxic chemicals in secrecy in various bases including Puchon, Kyonggi Province.
					
					  The burial of toxic materials by the U.S. imperialist aggressors seriously contaminated many areas of south Korea and affected even underground water, having a serious impact on the cultivation of crops and the use of drinking water.
					
					 The areas occupied by the U.S. forces present in south Korea are known to be places with the best ecological environment from olden times.
					
					 The U.S. built military bases for aggression, training, bombing and firing in famous spots and mountains of south Korea for more than half a century in the past. While staging exercises for a war of aggression, its forces let various kinds of oil and toxic materials massive flow, seriously polluting the ecological environment and gravely threatening the life of the south Koreans. 
					
					 The U.S. brought to south Korea defoliant and massively sprayed it in the area along the Military Demarcation Line, seriously polluting the natural environment in the area and destroying a large area of land and causing civilians and soldiers who participated in spraying defoliant to die of incurable diseases.
					
					It was reported that one out of 10,000 people of south Korea suffered from cancer owing to his or her drinking of polluted underground water. One out of three families who drank underground water in the area where the U.S. oil pipeline ran met a grievous death due to various diseases including cancer.
					
					 20 persons out of 150 inhabitants of the village near the Waegwan U.S. military base died of cancer at young ages and more than 10 people are still suffering from cancer.
					
					 Tens of thousands of solders of the south Korean puppet army who had been driven for spraying defoliant by the U.S. forces are suffering from the aftereffect of defoliant.
					
					 Um To Nam, ex-soldier of the puppet army, has undergone sufferings, the end of his knuckles bent and left leg paralyzed since more than 20 years ago. He testified to the fact that "when I went to the area near Mt. Chondok I could not see any grass five decades since then."
					
					 Facts go to prove that the U.S. regards the land of south Korea as no more than a dumping ground and south Koreans as no more than colonial slaves.
					
					 Unpardonable are the U.S. criminals who have mercilessly destroyed the land of south Korea and reduced it to an area unfit for human inhabitation.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak Accused of Spawning Irregularities and Corruption
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak Accused of Spawning Irregularities and Corruption 
  Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The representative of the opposition Democratic Party of south Korea on May 27 accused traitor Lee Myung Bak of spawning irregularities and corruption, said south Korean MBC.
					 He held that Lee unilaterally appointed his confidant Un Jin Su as member of the Board of Audit and Inspection, sparking a scandal.
					
					 This being a hard reality, Lee is keeping mum about this, he noted, adding that he should realize himself the fate of a corrupt man cannot be otherwise.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Construction of Jeju Naval Base Opposed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Construction of Jeju Naval Base Opposed
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic organizations including the All-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking Jeju Military Base and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a press conference on May 26 in protest against the authorities' construction of the naval base.
					 At the press conference the organizations accused the military authorities of scheming to forcibly evacuate inhabitants in Kangjong village, Jeju Island for the above-said project. 
					 Villagers, members of civic and public organizations in different areas and peace activists of various countries have struggled to hold in check the illegal project but the authorities are frantically pushing forward the project defying their protest, they charged.
					
					 To check the construction of the naval base amounts to protecting the people's life and peace, they said, calling upon the people from all walks of life to turn out in the actions.

articles.title: Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Students affiliated to  the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century staged a protest against the puppet authorities in Seoul on May 29 demanding the settlement of the issue of registration fee.
					 The students staged a demonstration toward Chongwadae, strongly denouncing Lee Myung Bak for evading his commitment to halve the registration fee.
					
					 Meanwhile, a rally of students was held before the Myongdong Cathedral.
					
					 The participants said that they keenly felt during the rule of the present "government" that the issue of registration fee can hardly be settled unless the students take the lead in the actions.
					
					 If the "government" and the "Grand National Party" pay no heed to the demand of the students to the end, they will not escape a judgment, they warned.
					
					 That day students held a candlelight rally around Kwanghwamun, demanding the release of those arrested and the fulfillment of the commitment to halve the registration fee.

articles.title: US Imperialists' Tests of Efficacy of Toxic Chemicals Disclosed in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Imperialists' Tests of Efficacy of Toxic Chemicals Disclosed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the U.S. imperialists conducted tests of the efficacy of all kinds of toxic chemicals in south Korea in the 1960s, said south Korean KBS on May 27.
					 This fact was disclosed by an organization made up of ex-GIs who participated in the past Korean war when it opened to public a document of the U.S. government.
					
					 Recorded in the document is the fact that the U.S. sent varieties of very toxic weed killers to its units deployed in the frontline areas of south Korea in July, August and October, 1968 for the purpose of testing them.

articles.title: US Forces Hit for Polluting Environment
articles.content:
US Forces Hit for Polluting Environment
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on May 27 released a commentary denouncing the U.S. forces present in south Korea for polluting environment.
					 The commentary referred to the disclosure of the shocking fact that the same toxic chemicals as what was buried in the U.S. forces base in Waegwan were detected in the soil and underground water in the U.S. forces base in Puphyong, Inchon. 
					
					 It is natural to survey U.S. forces bases not only in Waegwan but in all areas of south Korea, it urged, and continued:
					
					 The joint investigation of the U.S. forces and the south Korean "government" now under way cannot guarantee the impartiality.
					
					 It called for halting the joint investigation and forming an all-people investigation team, not bound to the unequal south Korea-U.S. SOFA, so as to probe the truth about the case without fail.
					
					 Members of the Inchon City Assembly issued a statement on May 29 urging the puppet government to investigate the environmental pollution in the U.S. forces base in Puphyong, according to south Korean MBC.
					
					 Members of the Taegu and North Kyongsang Provincial Measure Committee for Probing the Truth about the Burial of Defoliant in the U.S. forces bases held a rally in Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province on the same day at which they demanded the probe into the truth about the crimes of the U.S. forces, south Korean KBS reported.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats in Leading Party Building Praised by Mexican Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats in Leading Party Building Praised by Mexican Political Figure
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the C.C., the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, issued a statement on May 24 on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of the start of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Kim Jong Il's nearly 50 year-long history of party leadership is a course in which he let the red flag of revolution fly invariably and vigorously, weathering the violent storm of history, he noted.
					
					 Kim Jong Il published many works, proving the truth and scientific accuracy of socialism with his perfect logic and clarified the basic principles and ways for the building of the revolutionary party and its activities, the chairman said, and went on:
					
					 The WPK flag is flying higher as an inspiring banner for all victories and miracles in the DPRK.
					
					 The WPK will always emerge victorious as the guide of the socialist cause as it is wisely led by Kim Jong Il.
					
					  The undying feats performed by him, the defender of the socialist cause, will shine long in the history of the WPK building.

articles.title: Single-minded Unity in DPRK Lauded by International Public
articles.content:
Single-minded Unity in DPRK Lauded by International Public 
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- International public is praising the Korean people for building a thriving nation by dint of single-minded unity around General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The chairman of the Russian Society for Promoting the Study and Dissemination of Comrade Kim Jong Il's Works said that the revolutionaries of Korea held President Kim Il Sung in high esteem as the centre of unity and laid down their lives for him without hesitation. The Korean people are now dynamically advancing toward a thriving nation, rallied close around Kim Jong Il, the chairman added.
					
					 The Pakistani newspaper Baluchistan Times noted that the DPRK, though not a big country, has such tremendous might that even the U.S. styling itself the world's "only superpower" dares not provoke it.
					
					 The DPRK has strong military power but it has more powerful might than this, the paper said, stressing that the society in the DPRK forms a community in which the leader, party and masses are united by the same destiny.
					
					 The Nepalese newspaper Majodur noted that the Korean people repose absolute trust in Kim Jong Il and entrust their destiny and future to him. They have become a great and powerful people who enjoy prosperity thanks to their single-minded unity, the paper added.
					
					 The Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional said the leader and people in the DPRK are firmly united not only in thought and purpose but in the sense of moral obligation, adding that this is the single-minded unity. 
					
					 The general secretary of the People's Rally for Socialism of Democratic Congo noted that the Korean people are striving hard to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve national reunification, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the centre of leadership.

articles.title: China Calls for Protecting Cross-straits Peaceful Development
articles.content:
China Calls for Protecting Cross-straits Peaceful Development
 Beijing, May 30 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council of China at a press conference on May 25 called for jointly protecting the trend of times toward peaceful development.
					 Some time ago the chief executive of Taiwan said that the Taiwan side positively improved the cross-straits relations on the basis of "92 common understanding." In this regard the spokesman stressed that practice proved the peaceful development of the cross-straits relations brought substantial interests to the cross-straits compatriots, to those in Taiwan, in particular, as it was in conformity with the overall interests of the Chinese nationals.

articles.title: Chinese People's Daily on Operation of Rajin Port
articles.content:
Chinese People's Daily on Operation of Rajin Port 
Beijing, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Daily on May 27 carried an article titled "Jilin transports domestic trade goods across border". 
					 The paper introduced in detail the fact that the Hunchun Mining Co. of Jilin Coal Group has briskly used Rajin Port of the DPRK. 
					
					 It said: 
					
					 Experts analyzed that it is the shortest cut to transport mineral resources, grain, timber and other materials from the northeast China, Jilin and Heilongjiang provinces in particular, to the industrial regions on the southeast coast of China via Rajin Port. 
					
					 According to an estimation, the use of cargo ship from Rajin Port costs just about one third of the money spent for inland transport. 
					
					 The chief of the Hunchun Mining Co. said that the transport of coal through Rajin Port to Shanghai and other provinces on the southeast coast takes shorter time, covers shorter distance and requires less money than railway transport or marine transport through a port in a city of Liaoning Province. This helped solve a difficult problem arising in the coal transport to the south of China, he added. 
					
					 The Hunchun Mining Co. and the Shanghai Co. of China Steel Group signed a contract on purchase of huge amounts of coal in March this year. The Hunchun Mining Co. plans to transport 500,000 tons of coal across the border this year.

articles.title: S. Korea's "Strategic Rigidity" Obstructive to North-South Dialogue-Chinese Newspaper
articles.content:
S. Korea's "Strategic Rigidity" Obstructive to North-South Dialogue-Chinese Newspaper
 Beijing, May 30 (KCNA) -- Huan Qiu Shibao on May 21 carried an article titled "South Korea's strategic rigidity is obstructive to south-north dialogue."
					 The wrong stand taken by south Korea at a time when the international community desires the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula makes it difficult for the people to be optimistic about it.
					
					 Disclosing the injustice of the terms raised by south Korea as preconditions for the north-south dialogue, the paper continued:
					
					 The misjudgment of the situation in Korea led to the "strategic rigidity" on the part of south Korea. Its policy has been focused on "promoting change through pressure while waiting for it to occur." It, therefore, could not depart from the passive and old stand on the dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 South Korea's maintenance of the "strategic intention" may deprive it of an opportunity to improve the south-north relations and promote the denuclearization process. 
					
					 Some personages in south Korea and the West are underestimating the capability of the DPRK to exist and the stability of its system while overestimating the effect of the policy of sanctions and pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 The policy towards the DPRK shaped on the misjudgment that it will "collapse" does not stand to reason. This is a very dangerous one and it is bound to escalate tension and stand-off.
					
					 The south Korean side should show "strategic flexibility", the paper urged.

articles.title: Russian President Warns of New Arms Race
articles.content:
Russian President Warns of New Arms Race
 Moscow, May 30 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev at a press conference on May 27 warned of the possible new arms race.
					 The missile defense system to be deployed by the U.S. in Europe is clearly targeted on Russia, he said.
					
					 If the U.S. fails to agree with Russia over the MD, a new arms race will kick off after 2020, he warned.

articles.title: Putin on Formation of All-Russia People's Front
articles.content:
Putin on Formation of All-Russia People's Front
 Moscow, May 30 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin at a press conference on May 27 said that about 150 organizations decided to join the All-Russia People's Front.
					 He referred to the successful solution to the organizational issues related to the inauguration of the front.

articles.title: Russia Decides to Lift Ban on Grain Export
articles.content:
Russia Decides to Lift Ban on Grain Export
 Moscow, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Russian government recently decided to lift the ban on grain export which had been in force since August last year.
					 It was reported that the measure taken due to the abnormal drought would be lifted from July 1 this year.

articles.title: Cambodia Plans to Build Satellite City
articles.content:
Cambodia Plans to Build Satellite City
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Cambodian government approved of the plan to develop a new satellite city in Phnom Penh's Chroy Changvar peninsula.
					 The would-be new town will cover the area of 387 hectares.
					
					 The government decided to allot a large amount of money for the project.

articles.title: New Natural Gas Field Discovered in Mexico
articles.content:
New Natural Gas Field Discovered in Mexico
						
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A new natural gas field has been recently discovered in Mexico.
					 It is situated in the deep waters of the Gulf of Mexico, with the estimated reserves of 11.3-17 billion cubic meters.

articles.title: Cooperation among Developing Countries in Various Fields
articles.content:
Cooperation among Developing Countries in Various Fields
  Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Tanzania and India agreed to explore new areas of bilateral cooperation in the sectors of education, agriculture, health, etc. on May 27.
					 Costa Rica and Peru on Thursday signed a Free Trade Agreement (FTA).

articles.title: CCN decide inaugurar conferencia nacional para reunificaci√≥n
articles.content:

articles.title: Portavoz del CDN revela la verdad del contacto secreto N-S en Beijing
articles.content:
Portavoz del CDN revela la verdad del contacto secreto N-S en Beijing
						
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- El 19 de mayo pasado, la camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak divulg√≥ por conducto del portavoz de Chongwadae (Casa Azul) un rumor como si la parte Sur hubiera convencido a la parte Norte la "verdadera intenci√≥n" de la llamada "propuesta de Berl√≠n" de Lee en el contacto N-S a puerta cerrada celebrado recientemente en Beijing.
					  Ella ha difundido luego las mismas versiones en varias ocasiones.
					
					  Al respecto, el portavoz del Comit√© de Defensa Nacional de la Rep√∫blica Popular Democr√°tica de Corea respondi√≥ hoy como lo siguiente a la ATCC:
					
					  La camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak son grandes maestros de falsificaci√≥n, que inventan lo que no ha ocurrido y se obstinan a negar sus actos, y unos bribones que no cumplen sus promesas hechas ante la naci√≥n.
					
					  Lo muestran el incidente del hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el de fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					  Es una pura mentira que en el contacto secreto en Beijing la parte Sur haya explicado a la parte Norte la "verdadera intenci√≥n" de la "propuesta de Berl√≠n" de Lee.
					
					  Ya que ella ha publicado primero los resultados falsificados del contacto secreto de Beijing por conducto del portavoz de Chongwadae y divulga rumores falsos al respecto, nos vemos obligados a revelar la verdad de lo ocurrido.
					
					  Impotente de eludir la responsabilidad por haber llevado a la cat√°strofe las relaciones N-S, esa banda se dio cuenta de que ir√° de mal en peor la crisis de gobernaci√≥n en lo que resta de su mandato.
					
					  A los comienzos de abril de este a√±o, suplic√≥ varias veces a la RPDC que "sostengan un contacto a puerta cerrada para la 'cumbre' prometiendo no cuestionar el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta surcoreana 'Cheonan' y el de fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong".
					
					  A√±adi√≥ que la "pol√≠tica sobre el Norte" de Lee Myung Bak es "mal interpretada" por el Norte y persigue realmente el mejoramiento de las relaciones √≠ntercoreanas.
					
					  Sin embargo, Kim Chon Sik, jefe del gabinete de pol√≠tica del Ministerio de Reunificaci√≥n t√≠tere, Hong Chang Hwa, director del Servicio de Inteligencia, Kim Thae Hyo, secretario jefe por la estrategia exterior de la oficina de los secretarios de Chongwadae, y otros delegados surcoreanos, que participaron en el contacto secreto a partir del 9 de mayo, comenzaron a hacer trampas para obtener la "disculpa" de la RPDC diciendo, en contrario a lo que ha prometido al principio, que los incidentes arriba referidos son una "monta√±a a atravesar con inteligencia" para mejorar las relaciones Sur-Norte.
					
					  Cuando nuestra parte refut√≥ esa opini√≥n destacando que resulta rid√≠culo hablar de la supuesta "disculpa" por esos casos enajenados de la RPDC y las justas medidas de √©sta para la autodefensa, ellos suplicaron la "concesi√≥n" del Norte proponiendo publicar al mundo una "variante conciliatoria que no signifique 'disculpa' para el Norte, pero s√≠ la parezca para el Sur" y agregando que el Norte es distinto al Sur donde la prensa es incontrolable.
					
					  Nuestra parte les exigi√≥ que regresaran inmediatamente a Se√∫l dejando en claro que no hace falta tratar el problema de la cumbre condicionada por esa injusta "disculpa".
					
					  Entonces, ellos intentaron prolongar a toda costa el contacto enumerando que resta poco el mandato de Lee Myung Bak, no tienen el tiempo las actuales autoridades y es m√°s conveniente promover las relaciones Sur-Norte con las fuerzas conservadoras que las progresistas.
					
					  Diciendo que tienen elaborados ya los tr√°mites de la apertura de la "cumbre", volvieron a implorar a nuestra parte que entienda la situaci√≥n inc√≥moda de ellos.
					
					  Seg√∫n el programa trazado por ellos, a condici√≥n de que sea resuelto el problema sobre los dos incidentes, tendr√°n lugar en la segunda quincena de mayo las conversaciones ministeriales previas a la "cumbre" para anunciar los puntos acordados; la primera "cumbre" N-S se celebrar√° en la segunda quincena de junio en Phanmunjom, la segunda, en Pyongyang a dos meses despu√©s de la primera y la tercera, durante la cumbre de seguridad nuclear prevista para marzo del pr√≥ximo a√±o.
					
					  Al respecto, nuestra parte expuso su firme posici√≥n de que no habr√° la cumbre mientras la parte Sur se mantenga en su pol√≠tica hostil a la RPDC hablando de continuo como ahora de la "renuncia nuclear, primero" y la "disculpa" por los dos incidentes.
					
					  Los delegados surcoreanos trataron esta vez de sobornar a nuestros delegados con un sobre de dinero pidiendo que "expresen 'l√°stima' como m√≠nimo por los dos incidentes, se re√∫nan otra vez en Malaysia para concluir ese tema y promuevan r√°pido la apertura de la 'cumbre'".
					
					Pero, pasaron tremenda pena ante el rechazo rotundo de nuestros delegados.
					
					Rogaron que nuestra parte "guardara secreto de lo mencionado en el contacto secreto, ya que la sociedad surcoreana es muy complicada a diferencia del Norte".
					
					  Volvieron a solicitar lo mismo diciendo que el ministro de Reunificaci√≥n, Hyon In Thaek, el jefe del  Servicio de Inteligencia, el jefe del gabinete de los secretarios de la Presidencia y otros quienes atienden este contacto secreto seg√∫n la indicaci√≥n directa del presidente Lee Myung Bak, y los hombres enviados al terreno de contacto son los √∫nicos conocedores de esta cita".
					
					  Sin embargo, esos tipejos fueron los primeros en publicar en la prensa los resultados del contacto de Beijing con el objetivo de hacer propaganda de la "racionalidad" de la llamada "propuesta de Berlin" del traidor Lee Myung Bak.
					
					  Hasta aqu√≠ la verdad de lo ocurrido en ese contacto en que seg√∫n lo anunciado por el portavoz de Chongwadae antes y despu√©s del 19 de mayo, se hizo entender al Norte la "verdadera intenci√≥n" de la pol√©mica "propuesta de Berl√≠n".
					
					  Si la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak tuviera de veras la voluntad de mejorar las relaciones √≠ntercoreanas, no debi√≥ soltar las maldiciones como la "propuesta de Berl√≠n" ni dar a la publicidad ingratamente el contacto secreto tergiversando su contenido. 
					
					  Todos los hechos demuestran elocuentemente que la camarilla del traidor Lee est√° dando el √∫ltimo coletazo para eludir la responsabilidad por la quiebra de relaciones √≠ntercoreanas, ya que se le va acabando su mandato.
					
					  Pero, no puede evadir de cualquier manera sus cr√≠menes antinacionales y anti-reunificaci√≥n cometidos durante los tres a√±os de su mandato.
					
					  La RPDC se esforzar√° en todo lo posible por la paz, la reunificaci√≥n y la estabilidad de la Pen√≠nsula Coreana, pero no se tratar√° por m√°s tiempo con la banda de Lee que act√∫a suciamente con el alma de doble filo para cumplir sus siniestras ambiciones pol√≠ticas.

articles.title: Comit√© norte√±o denuncia maniobras anti-reunificaci√≥n del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Comit√© norte√±o denuncia maniobras anti-reunificaci√≥n del Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- Recientemente, la banda de conservadores t√≠teres del Sur de Corea impidi√≥ la visita a Kaesong del Comit√© Sure√±o para la Ejecuci√≥n de la Declaraci√≥n Conjunta del 15 de Junio para tener contacto entre las partes norte√±a, sure√±a y ultramarina del Comit√© Conjunto Nacional para la Ejecuci√≥n de la Declaraci√≥n Conjunta del 15 de Junio.

articles.title: Encuentro de amistad por D√≠a Internacional de la Infancia
articles.content:
Encuentro de amistad por D√≠a Internacional de la Infancia
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este mi√©rcoles en la Zona de Recreo Taesongsan el encuentro de amistad de los ni√±os y mujeres capitalinos y  extranjeros en conmemoraci√≥n del 61¬∫ aniversario del D√≠a Internacional de la Infancia (primero de junio).

					Ro Song Sil, presidenta del Comit√© Central de la Uni√≥n de Mujeres Democr√°ticas de Corea, en su discurso de felicitaci√≥n, dio calurosa bienvenida a los ni√±os a lo largo del pa√≠s, que crecen como protagonistas de la Corea del Songun bajo el regazo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, y a otros extranjeros de varios pa√≠ses participantes en el acto.
